snippet: The government said Wednesday that it would reopen its investigation into the involvement of British forces in the 1989 killing of Patrick Finucane, a lawyer who had represented Irish Republic Army activists.
lead_paragraph: The government said Wednesday that it would reopen its investigation into the involvement of British forces in the 1989 killing of Patrick Finucane, a lawyer who had represented Irish Republic Army activists.

headline.seo: Ulster Inquiry to Reopen in Britain
